Events that occurred on 8 September.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1918 - J.R.R. Tolkien attends his final medical board examination in Kingston-upon-Hull.
1943 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 49c.
1948 - Artist Michael Hague is born.
1953 - Actor John McGlynn is born.
1955 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 168a.
1955 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to a fan.
1962 - J.R.R. Tolkien begins writing Letter 241.
1971 - Actor Martin Freeman is born.
2008 - Tolkien's Oxford is published.
2009 - Halifirien: The Hallowed Mountain is released online.
2009 - The Tolkien Estate, The Tolkien Trust and HarperCollins settle their lawsuit with New Line Cinema and the Saul Zaentz Company.
2010 - The Lord of the Rings Online: Volume III: Allies of the King, "Ride of the Grey Company" is released in North America, which includes free-to-play for current and former subscribers.
2016 - Oxonmoot 2016 at St Antony's College.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
